answers.answer: The most important indicator is always symptoms, and those two are often related to being hypothyroid.  His lab results also indicate the same, since Free T4 is rock bottom, and Free T3 is below the middle of the range.  Many members say that symptom relief required Free T4 at the middle of its range at minimum, and Free T3 in the upper end of its range.Also, hypo patients are also frequently too low in the ranges for Vitamin D, B12 and ferritin.  That can cause symptoms, and low D and ferritin can also affect how thyroid hormone is metabolized.  If he has tested for those, please post results.

question: I don't have his previous labs thoughHe's currently on Armour 105mgTSH 0.64 (0.36-3.74)FT3 2.95 (2.18-3.98)FT4 0.77 (0.76-1.46)He says he feels fine but I know he's been experiencing more anxiety lately and some minor hair loss that he thinks is associated with stress or missing not taking his meds for a couple days a couple weeks ago. He was just diagnosed with pre-diabetes.
title: Husband's labs, doctor says he's fine
